item.title: Paula add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Those who can't do, teach. And those who can't teach, teach gym." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Paula add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "In a weak moment, I have written a book." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Paula add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Paula add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Paula add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Nature is a haunted house--but Art--is a house that tries to be haunted." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Paula add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Paula add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Ducking for apples -- change one letter and it's the story of my life." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Paula add a quote by Diane Arbus
item.description: "There's a quality of legend about freaks. Like a person in a fairy tale who stops you and demands that you answer a riddle. Most people go through life dreading they'll have a traumatic experience. Freaks were born with their trauma. They've already passed their test in life. They're aristocrats." -- Diane Arbus

item.title: Paula add a quote by Kubrick Stanley
item.description: "Take a stress pill and think things over-- HAL in 2001" -- Kubrick Stanley

item.title: Paula add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Redemption, n.</b> Deliverance of sinners from the penalty of their sin through their murder of the deity against whom they sinned. The doctrine of Redemption is the fundamental mystery of our holy religions, and whoso believeth in it shall not perish, but have everlasting life in which to try to understand it." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Paula add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "All are lunatics, but he who can analyze his delusion is called a philosopher." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Paula add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Paula add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Paula add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Paula add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Paula add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Paula add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "What fresh hell is this?" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Paula add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I hate writing, I love having written." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Paula add a quote by Stevie Smith
item.description:
"Not Waving but Drowning
Nobody heard him, the dead man, But still he lay moaning: I was much further out than you thought And not waving but drowning.
Poor chap, he always loved larking And now he's dead It must have been too cold for him his heart gave way, They said.
Oh, no no no, it was too cold always (Still the dead one lay moaning) I was much too far out all my life And not waving but drowning." -- Stevie Smith

item.title: Paula add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "The box is only temporary." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Paula add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Paula add a quote by Stephen Crane
item.description:
"<b>A Man Said to the Universe</b>
A man said to the universe: “Sir, I exist!” “However,” replied the universe, “The fact has not created in me A sense of obligation." -- Stephen Crane

item.title: Paula add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "The best way out is always through." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Paula add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "To be a poet is a condition, not a profession." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Paula add a quote by Werner Herzog
item.description: "What would an ocean be without a monster lurking in the dark? It would be like sleep without dreams." -- Werner Herzog
